content: woodland glen shawl by denise e m bartels y arn lace weight i used handspun spun from polwarth wool y ardage approximately 900 yards 110 grams n eedles i used us 1 5 2 5 mm but i knit very loosely d epth at center 35 inches l ength 76 inches 1 copyright ©2023 denise e m bartels i had fun playing with shetland stitch patterns to design this shawl and i hope you have fun knitting it most of the charts show only the right-side row since the wrong-side row are purl with seed stitch borders the exception is chart 5 which shows all row because it includes a stitch pattern that is worked on every row 2 copyright ©2023 denise e m bartels s tart with a tab cast-on i like a seed stitch edging instead of a garter stitch one because the gauge is closer to the stockinette gauge and i like the texture cast on 5 stitches and do 6 row of k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 on the seventh row k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 turn work 90 degrees and pick up 3 stitches along the side of the little tab you just made turn another 90 degrees and pick up 5 stitches along the cast-on edge you can also start with a provisional cast-on to give you the final 5 stitches w rong-side even row 2 - 192 and 206 - 230 are k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 purl to last 5 stitches k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 row 194 - 204 are included in chart 5 r ows 1 80 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 chart 1 k1 chart 1 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 r ows 81 - 128 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 chart 2 k1 chart 2 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 3 copyright ©2023 denise e m bartels r ows 129 - 172 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 chart 3 k1 chart 3 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 r ows 173 193 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 chart 4 k1 chart 4 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 r ows 194 - 204 chart 5 k1 chart 5 this chart includes even wrong-side row r ows 205 - 231 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 chart 6 k1 chart 6 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 resume standard wrong-side row b ind off loosely and block i bound off on the purl side using the bind off p1 *p1 slip stitches back to left needle and p2tog repeat from * 4 copyright ©2023 denise e m bartels 5 copyright ©2023 denise e m bartels 6 copyright ©2023 denise e m bartels 7 copyright ©2023 denise e m bartels 8 copyright ©2023 denise e m bartels n otes the symbol v is used to indicate a kfb knit in front and back not a slip_stitch it adds an extra stitch that in this pattern is removed in the next pattern row by an extra decrease don t worry if your stitch count does
